parallel

Class UnboundedMinHeapUnsynchronized

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.UnboundedMinHeapUnsynchronized

  • public class UnboundedMinHeapUnsynchronized
extends java.lang.Object
    Unbounded version of the class BoundedMinHeapUnsynchronized, offering the essential needed API of a min-heap data structure. Its amortized costs are the same as for the bounded min-heap data structure.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2017-2022

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private BoundedMinHeapUnsynchronized _minHeap 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnboundedMinHeapUnsynchronized(int init_size)
      public constructor assumes that the objects to be passed in will be pairs of the form utils.Pair(Object first, Double second) and the comparison between objects will be on the basis of the second argument of the pair (unless second arguments are equal).
      UnboundedMinHeapUnsynchronized(int init_size, java.util.Comparator comp)
      public constructor requires besides an initial size estimate, a comparator object to compare any two objects in the heap.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      adds an element to this heap.
      void decreaseKey(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object update)
      find the object key in the min-heap, and move it up so that its position matches the position for the value of the update object.

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public void addElement(java.lang.Object o)
        adds an element to this heap. Duplicates are not allowed. Notice that this implementation never throws IndexOutOfBoundsException; instead it will eventually throw OutOfMemoryException when the heap memory runs out. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap (assuming O(1) complexity for hash-map operations containsKey(),put()).
        Parameters:
        o - Object must be comparable via this object's comparator member (_comp)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if o already exists in min-heap

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove()
        remove the min-element from this heap. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap.
        Returns:
        Object the min-element in this heap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if min-heap is empty

      • size

        public int size()
        return the current number of elements in this min-heap. Obviously, O(1) operation.
        Returns:
        int

      • getMaxSize

        public int getMaxSize()
        return the current capacity of this min-heap. Obviously, O(1) operation.
        Returns:
        int

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets this heap, letting the comparator as is.

      • decreaseKey

        public void decreaseKey(java.lang.Object key,
                        java.lang.Object update)
        find the object key in the min-heap, and move it up so that its position matches the position for the value of the update object. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap, assuming O(1) complexity for hash-map operations remove(),get(),put().
        Parameters:
        key - Object the object to be updated in this min-heap
        update - Object the updated object that replaces the key above
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key doesn't exist in the min-heap
